title: Postgraduate Promotion Activities Instruction Letter (IMIC-S520-03) | Yönerge
text: Instruction No IMIC-S520-03-V03 Effective Date 02-05-2012 Update Date 12-06-2024 Related Unit / Owner MIC / Pazarlama ve Kurumsal İletişim Direktörlüğü Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim The aim of the document is to establish the rules regarding the promotion of graduate programs by faculties. Scope This document covers the MIC-Marketing Unit, the Vice President for Education, and faculties. The rules regarding the promotion of graduate programs are within the scope of this document. Principle The promotional strategy and approach for graduate programs should be integrated and aligned with the university's overall promotional strategy. The MIC is a support function in graduate promotion. Statutory Basis Definitions / Abbreviations MIC: Marketing and Institutional Communications Directorate FASS: Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences FENS: Faculty of Engineering and Natural Sciences SBS: Sabancı Business School Regulations Rules 1. The promotional strategy and approach for Sabancı University's graduate programs are determined within the framework of the annual marketing plan and/or the marketing plan for the program in question. 2. At the beginning of the academic year, a meeting is held with each faculty meets to determine: a. Annual business (program) goals, b. Annual marketing goals, c. Target audience, d. Key messages, e. Communication tools, f. The promotional calendar. 3. MIC prepares the marketing plan in collaboration with the faculty, based on the main items identified above. 4. A division of labor is established between the faculty and MIC within the framework of the agreed-upon plan. 5. Plans are implemented in line with this division of labor. 6. At the end of the academic year, measurement and evaluation are conducted to inform the following year's activities. Related Procedures Related Forms Related Form Links
